description.narrative: The activity is part of a larger programme implemented by the Strengthening Civil Courage Alliance, consisting of ABAAD – Resource Center for Gender Equality, Amnesty International The Netherlands, DefendDefenders, PAX and their partner networks.

The programme therefore aspires to support human rights defenders and civil society actors in their efforts to counter the repression of civic space (including social media), to prevent specific violations of housing and residency rights, and to address companies in the UN Database and their investors on reducing their involvement in Israeli human rights violations. Interventions may include development of skills and leadership, research, and joint advocacy.

The programme will in particular work with Palestinian and Israeli (women) human rights defenders, other civil society actors and Palestinian and Israeli citizens. It will address authorities, international duty bearers, companies and financial institutions on their opportunities to contribute to equal rights for Palestinian and Israeli citizens.

The programme’s wider context include the ongoing occupation of Palestinian land, the increased fragmentation of the Palestinian population and the suppression of civic space, including delegitimization of Palestinian and Israeli human rights defenders and other civil society actors. In this complex context the programme focuses on the violations of the housing and residency rights of Palestinians in East Jerusalem and Area C. Addressing these violations requires commitment and an active role of a variety of stakeholders.

participating-org.narrative: ABAAD – Resource Center for Gender Equality

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 19318 3501 DH Utrecht The Netherlands

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movement, and government institutions

title.narrative: # of CSOs with increased L&A capacities

comment.narrative: 3 partners (other, not women-led and not youth-led) analysed their L & A capacities in one or more of 8 areas (A. Produce evidence, B. Inspiring trust among power holders, C. Represent constituency interests, D. Analyse the political arena, E. Produce tailored messages, F.Work collectively, G. Build rapport with power holders, H. Adapt to ongoing environmental changes), determining the need to prioritize strengthening capacity areas D and G.

By the end of 2022, 3 partners (other, not women-led and not youth-led) will have strengthened L & A capacities in D. Analyse the political Arena, and G. Build rapport with power holders, and specifically in areas D1. able to do stakeholder & institutional analyses, D3. knowledge of relevant laws, policies & treaties, G2. Able to analyze power holders’ personal & institutional interests, G3. proximity to power holders.

title.narrative: Output 1.2.1 - Advocacy initiatives (e.g. policy briefs and/ or research, meetings with senior officials in social media companies, public campaigns) by local and Alliance partners towards social media companies
# and description of advocacy initiatives by local partners towards social media companies

comment.narrative: Local partner is in touch with social media companies and regularly conducts advocacy initiatives
Good and influential (official) working relation with all main social media companies

title.narrative: Output 2.1.1 - Staff of CSO local partners trained and mentored by Alliance partners on monitoring, reporting and L&A on ESC rights
# and description of advocacy initiatives by local partners in light of ESC rights

comment.narrative: Local partner organisations conduct initiatives but not always in coordination with other organization or with coherent messaging and targets.
Solid advocacy strategies of local partner organisations, cooperating/aligning efforts and targeting the relevant actors

title.narrative: # of CSOs included in SPs (Strategic Partners) programmes

comment.narrative: Partners are selected based on expertise. Some partnerrelations existed before the start of this program, some are new based on added value to the programme, specific expertise and relevant network/outreach
Having had more discussions with partners on role of women in leadership posititions
With six existing partner organisations a solid and cooperative partnership. Ambitions for the future, increase in partners more specifically youth- and/or women-led
More cooperation between partners increasing influence and effectiveness increasing overall coherence of programme and more partners women-led mainstreaming female leadership

title.narrative: Outcome 1.2 - Social media companies (Facebook, TikTok, Twitter, Instagram) have modified some of their community standards and related regulations, in order to counter suppression of space for Palestinian and international HRDs and organisations
# and description of cases where social media companies have modified community standards or related regulations

comment.narrative: Policies of social media companies are discriminatory and algorithms flag Palestinian content and political speech arbitrarily and indiscriminately. Palestinian and Arabic content is over-moderated while anti-Palestinian incitement and hate speech is treated with less scrutiny.
Change in policies of social media companies. Less discriminatory content moderation policies
